[[Image:Richard Madden & George R.R. Martin.jpg|right|thumb|200px|Richard Madden and George R.R. Martin during the filming of the pilot episode.]]

'''Richard Madden''' (born 18 June 1986) is a Scottish actor and model. He is best known for his appearance in the short-lived 2009 series ''[[wikipedia:Hope Springs|Hope Springs]]'' and his role as real-life musician [[wikipedia:Kirk Brandon|Kirk Brandon]] in ''[[wikipedia:Worried About the Boy|Worried About the Boy]]'', a dramatisation of the life of [[wikipedia:Boy George|Boy George]]. In 2011 he had a leading role in the British comedy-drama series ''[[wikipedia:Sirens (UK TV series)|Sirens]]'', playing gay paramedic Ashley Greenwick. In 2012 he appeared in the BBC adaptation of ''[[wikipedia:Birdsong (TV serial)|Birdsong]]'' as World War I officer Captain Weir. His most recent role is as Prince Charming in the live-action adaptation of Disney's ''[[wikipedia:Cinderella (2015 film)|Cinderella]]''.

He stars in [[HBO]]'s ''[[Game of Thrones]]'' as [[Robb Stark]]. He was announced in the role on 20 August 2009. During filming of the pilot he won the "Best-Dressed Man in Scotland 2009" Award, but was unable to attend the ceremony due to his workload. He was part of the initial starring cast and remains a member of the starring cast for the [[Season 2|second]] and [[Season 3|third seasons]].

Madden intentionally only read the novels that corresponded to the current season, i.e. he only read the second novel after Season 1 ended, to prepare for Season 2. Madden was aware from the very beginning, however, that Robb Stark dies in the third novel, because other people spoiled it for him very early on.<ref>[http://www.rollingstone.com/movies/news/game-of-thrones-q-a-richard-madden-on-robb-starks-endgame-20130602 Rolling Stone]</ref>
